turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Onion.
turn.1: What is meant by neck rot?
turn.2: Neck rot is a fungal disease affecting onions in storage.
turn.3: What is the cause of this ?
turn.4: It is caused by "Botrytis allii", which attacks the neck and upper parts of the bulb, causing a grey mould to develop.
turn.5: What are the symptoms of the disease?
turn.6: The symptoms often first occur where the bulb has been damaged and spread downwards in the affected scales.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Large quantities of spores are produced and crust-like sclerotia may also develop.
turn.9: What do the spores look like?
turn.10: In time, a dry rot sets in and the bulb becomes a dry, mummified structure.
turn.11: Is there anything else that is interesting?
turn.12: This disease may be present throughout the growing period, but only manifests itself when the bulb is in storage.
